0.title: Late Sonali Phogat's last film 'Prerna' will be released soon: Film makers
0.article_body: Late BJP leader and actress Sonali Phogat's last film titled 'Prerna' will be released soon, said the makers of the movie on Monday. Director/Producer Naresh Dhanda, who plays the role of the father-in-law in the film, said that 'Prerna' is a motivational film. Sonali Phogat's daughter Yashodhara released the movie's poster on Friday.

1.title: Gadkari shares Akshay Kumar's ad on 6-airbags, Twitter users say 'ad promotes dowry'
1.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari recently shared an ad on road safety and six airbags that featured actor Akshay Kumar. In the ad, Akshay taunts a father at a wedding for sending his daughter and son-in-law in a car with just two airbags. Commenting on it, Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi said that the ad promoted the "criminal act of dowry".

2.title: Teen killed boy in Nuh to evade studies, hoped it'd shut madarsa: Police
2.article_body: Days after a decomposed body of an 11-year-old boy was found in a mosque on the premises of a madrasa in Nuh, police have said that a teenager allegedly killed the victim as he did not want to study at the madrasa. The accused hoped that a "big incident" would lead to the madrasa being shut down.

3.title: How much prize money did US Open 2022 winners and runners-up get?
3.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz and Iga Świątek bagged a prize money of $2.6 million (over ₹20 crore) each for winning men's and women's singles titles, respectively at US Open 2022. Casper Ruud and Ons Jabeur, who finished runners-up in their respective categories, won $1.3 million (over ₹10 crore) each. Alcaraz won his maiden Grand Slam title, while Świątek won her third.

4.title: Mount Mary fair begins in Bandra; festival to be live-streamed
4.article_body: The Mount Mary fair, also known as Bandra fair, commenced on Sunday after a gap of two-year due to COVID-19 pandemic. The festival will be live-streamed through social media handles and multiple LED screens have been placed outside the church so that the public can watch the religious ceremonies. The fair will reportedly have around 430 shops and food courts.

5.title: 19-year-old Alcaraz wins US Open 2022, becomes youngest men's world number one in history
5.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz defeated 23-year-old Casper Ruud of Norway in the final to win US Open 2022 men's singles title. It's Alcaraz's first-ever Grand Slam title victory. He won the final with scoreline of 6-4, 2-6, 7-6(7-1), 6-3. Alcaraz has become the youngest men's world number one in tennis history, breaking Lleyton Hewitt's record (20 years and 9 months).

6.title: Was exhausted & burned out: Amala on taking break from films in 2019
6.article_body: Actress Amala Paul, speaking about her break from films in 2019, said that she did not "quit" films as her films weren't doing well or she wasn't getting offers. "I got the biggest offers of my career at that point...I had to say no because I simply needed a break," she stated. "I was tired, exhausted, burned out," she added.

7.title: Delhi records 137 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths
7.article_body: Delhi reported 137 fresh cases of COVID-19 and two deaths due to the infection in the past 24 hours, the city health department informed on Sunday. With the new cases, the city's active caseload stood at 717. Moreover, as per health department data, the national capital's COVID-19 death toll climbed to 26,493.

8.title: I agree with his anger: Real Madrid manager on Asensio's outburst
8.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti said he understands forward Marco Asensio's anger at not being brought in to play during their match against Mallorca. "I agree with him. It's normal, it means he wants to play...he has been the most affected," said Ancelotti. A video showing Asensio kicking and throwing bottles in the dugout during the match has gone viral.

9.title: Red Bull's Verstappen wins Italian GP, closes in on 2nd world title
9.article_body: Red Bull F1's Max Verstappen started seventh on the grid and went on to win the 2022 Italian GP to potentially be one win away from his second world championship. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc finished second, ahead of Mercedes' George Russell. Debutant Nyck de Vries scored his first points for Williams F1 in a race that ended behind the safety car.

10.title: Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan to win their 6th Asia Cup, their first since 2014
10.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by 23 runs in the final in Dubai to win Asia Cup for the sixth time. Bhanuka Rajapaksa top-scored for Sri Lanka in the final with 71*(45), while Pramod Madushan took four wickets and Wanindu Hasaranga took three wickets. It's Sri Lanka's first Asia Cup victory since 2014, when also they defeated Pakistan in the final.

11.title: Make sure the engine is right: Leclerc fumes at Ferrari F1 engineer
11.article_body: Ferrari F1 driver Charles Leclerc gave an angry reaction after his race engineer told him to be careful about the way he was shifting gears during the 2022 Italian Grand Prix. "I can't guys...Make sure the engine is right," said Leclerc, who finished second despite being on pole. The race ended with Leclerc 116 points behind championship leader Max Verstappen.

12.title: People of J&K against terrorism, helping police: LG Manoj Sinha
12.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said that the Union Territory is witnessing a change, and people are against terrorism and helping the police deal with it. He added that after revoking Article 370 in 2019, the situation changed and the backbone of terrorism was broken. "Earlier, peace was purchased, now it is established," Sinha said.

13.title: Death toll from migrant boat capsize off Tunisia rises to 11
13.article_body: The death toll from a migrant boat capsize last week off the coast of Tunisia in the Mediterranean Sea has risen to 11, the Tunisian state media reported on Sunday. The boat was carrying 37 people, out of which 14 have been rescued so far. As many as 12 occupants of the boat are still missing.

14.title: UP CM Adityanath announces ₹50 lakh ex-gratia to families of martyrs
14.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced ex-gratia of ₹50 lakh to family members of Army Jawan Naik Suraj Pal and Navy Jawan Haresh Kumar Singh. Expressing grief, CM Adityanath said that the government stands with the families of the departed soldiers. A government job will also be provided to one member each from their families.

15.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrives in Edinburgh after 6-hour journey
15.article_body: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrived in Edinburgh on Sunday after a six-hour journey from Balmoral Castle, her summer home in the Scottish Highlands. The coffin will remain overnight at the Palace of Holyroodhouse, Elizabeth's official Scottish residence. It will be taken to Edinburgh's St Giles Cathedral for a service on Monday. The queen's state funeral will be held on September 19.

16.title: Novak Djokovic will be allowed to play 2023 Australian Open: Reports
16.article_body: Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic will reportedly be able to play the Australian Open in 2023 despite not taking his COVID-19 vaccination. Djokovic was deported from Australia earlier this year, ahead of the tournament and given a three-year travel ban. Australia's new immigration minister has reportedly agreed to remove Djokovic's ban and allow him to compete in the Grand Slam.

17.title: Krejcikova complains of smelling weed during US Open doubles match
17.article_body: Czech Republic tennis player Barbora Krejcikova complained to the chair umpire that she could smell weed being smoked in the stands during her women's doubles semifinal match in the US Open. The umpire then gestured towards the crowd to not smoke inside the stadium. Earlier in the tournament, during a men's singles match, Nick Kyrgios also had a similar complaint.

18.title: Italian govt, UAE firm pick up 44% stake in Titagarh Wagons' subsidiary Firema
18.article_body: The Italian government and a UAE-based private equity firm, Hawk Eye DMCC, have together picked up nearly 44% stake in Titagarh Wagons’ fully-owned subsidiary Firema SpA. The Italian government picked 30.30% stake for 10 million euros, while Hawk Eye picked 13.64% stake for 4.5 million euros. The remaining 5.5 million euros was infused by a Titagarh Group company.

19.title: 4 of 6 criminals who escaped from jail lynched by mob in Meghalaya
19.article_body: Four of the six undertrial prisoners, who escaped from a jail in Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills on Saturday after overpowering prison guards, have allegedly been lynched by a mob in Shangpung village, Meghalaya DGP LR Bishnoi said. Bishnoi added that their bodies will be taken to hospital for identification. The mob had allegedly attacked the prisoners with rods and sticks.

20.title: You're a great champion: Lewandowski to fellow Pole Swiatek on her US Open win
20.article_body: Congratulating Iga Swiatek after she became the first-ever Polish woman to win the US Open, compatriot and Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski tweeted, "You're a great champion, and you've proven it yet again on the biggest stage." He added, "I am so happy for you!" World number one Swiatek defeated Ons Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5) in her maiden US Open final.

21.title: Saiyami, Gulshan Devaiah to star in a film produced by Anurag Kashyap
21.article_body: Actors Gulshan Devaiah and Saiyami Kher are teaming up for a film, which is being produced by filmmaker Anurag Kashyap. Speaking about reuniting with Gulshan after 'Unpaused Season 1', Saiyami said, "There is a comfort level working with him." She added that Gulshan is extremely creative and an amazing actor. The yet-untitled film is being shot in Hyderabad.

22.title: Govt planning to set up trade promotion body: Piyush Goyal
22.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has said the redesigning of the Commerce Department is under process. "We are in...process to redesign the structure of the Commerce Ministry and one of the ideas in front of us is to set up a 'trade promotion body'," he said. "[The]...body would be set up to devise an overall strategy to achieve targets," he added.

23.title: Steve Smith 'signals' free-hit after smashing six, video goes viral
23.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith smashed a six on bowling of New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham in the third ODI and immediately 'signalled' a free-hit. Smith made the free-hit gesture towards the umpires, indicating that the next ball should be a free hit as there were five fielders outside the 30-yard circle. "Steve Smith’s awareness is second to none," a commentator said.

24.title: Stuart Broad overtakes Glenn McGrath's tally of wickets in Test cricket
24.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad on Sunday became the second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket among fast bowlers. With his three-wicket haul in South Africa's second innings in the third Test, Broad took his tally of wickets in Test cricket to 566. He overtook former Australia fast bowler Glenn McGrath, who had taken 563 wickets in 124 Test matches.

25.title: Squid Game's Lee Jung-jae to star in 'Star Wars' series 'The Acolyte'
25.article_body: Lee Jung-jae, who starred in South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', has signed on to play the male lead in 'Star Wars' series 'The Acolyte'. Meanwhile, 'The Hunger Games' actress Amandla Stenberg has been roped in to play the female lead. 'The Acolyte' is set a century before the events of 'Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace'.

26.title: Will try to maintain communication despite Turkish Prez's remarks: Greece
26.article_body: Athens would try to keep communication channels with Ankara open despite Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's recent "unacceptable" comments, Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis said on Sunday. Erdogan had said that Turkey was ready to "do what is necessary" in the wake of the Greek "occupation" of demilitarised islands in the Aegean Sea. Notably, both Turkey and Greece are NATO members.

27.title: NASA shares pic of 9/11 terror attacks as captured from space
27.article_body: To commemorate 21st anniversary of 9/11 terror attacks, NASA took to Twitter to share a picture of the attacks as seen from International Space Station (ISS). NASA wrote, "On September 11, 2001...astronaut Frank Culbertson took this photo from...ISS of smoke rising from the Twin Towers in New York City." It added, "We honor the victims and heroes of the...attacks."

28.title: UAE's tourism revenues surpass $5 billion in first half of 2022
28.article_body: The tourism revenue of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) surpassed 19 billion dirhams (around $5 billion) in the first half of 2022, officials said on Sunday. "The total number of hotel guests reached 12 million, achieving 42% growth and we expect a strong tourism performance in this winter season," Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum said.

29.title: Minor girl gang-raped, set on fire in UP's Pilibhit district
29.article_body: A 16-year-old girl belonging to the Dalit community was allegedly gang-raped and set ablaze by two men in UP's Pilibhit district, police said on Saturday. The victim is undergoing treatment and is in a "serious condition", police added. The accused have been arrested and booked under the Indian Penal Code (IPC), the POCSO Act and the SC/ST Act, police informed.

30.title: Man Utd manager sets 20-goal target for Rashford for the season: Reports
30.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has reportedly set forward Marcus Rashford a 20-goal target for the ongoing 2022-23 season. "The manager wants Marcus to be United's number one striker and lead the line...Marcus is really happy," said a report. Rashford netted five goals last season but already has three goals and two assists in six matches this term.

31.title: What a knock: Akhtar on Rajapaksa's 71*(45) vs Pakistan in Asia Cup final
31.article_body: Praising Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa for his unbeaten half-century against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022 final, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar tweeted, "After 57/5, getting to 170 [is] what you call a great comeback. Rajapaksa, what a knock." Rajapaksa scored 71* off 45 deliveries. Sri Lanka put up a total of 170/6 in 20 overs.

32.title: Will gherao BJP lawmakers' homes over tea workers' demands: TMC's Abhishek
32.article_body: TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee on Sunday said houses of all BJP MPs and MLAs in West Bengal will be gheraoed if tea garden workers' demands aren't met by December. He demanded provident fund and gratuity benefits for over 3 lakh tea garden workers. "Though [PM] Narendra Modi was a tea seller, he did nothing for tea garden workers," he said.

33.title: Bhuvneshwar is world-class, I want to see his pace over 140 km/hr: Brett Lee
33.article_body: Calling India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar "world-class", Brett Lee said, "I want more from Bhuvneshwar because I know how good he is." He added, "I want to see Bhuvi continue to make sure he swings the ball both ways, keeps his pace over 140 km/hr, and if that happens, he leads from the front. He's a part of the wolf pack."

34.title: 1 dead, 40 injured after dam wall collapses at South African mine
34.article_body: At least one person was killed and 40 others were injured after a tailings dam wall collapsed at a dormant diamond mine in South Africa's Free State province on Sunday, provincial authorities said. The deluge of mud and water from the dam wall collapse swept away houses and cars. A pregnant woman is among those hospitalised, authorities informed.

35.title: Swiatek continues to get more and more confident in big moments: Annacone
35.article_body: Following Iga Swiatek's third Grand Slam win at US Open 2022, Roger Federer's former coach Paul Annacone said the world number one continues to get more and more confident in the big moments. "This is gonna be trouble for a lot of women on the women's tour," he added. The 21-year-old Pole has won two Grand Slams this year.

36.title: 1,200 gifts received by PM Modi to be auctioned from Sept 17 to Oct 2
36.article_body: Over 1,200 gift items received by PM Narendra Modi will be auctioned from September 17 to October 2 and the proceeds from it'll go to Namami Gange Mission. The auction will be conducted through the web portal, pmmementos.gov.in. The base price of the gifts ranges from ₹100 to ₹10 lakh and they are displayed at National Gallery of Modern Art.

37.title: Florence Pugh, Sebastian Stan to feature in Marvel's 'Thunderbolts'
37.article_body: Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige has announced the cast of the upcoming film 'Thunderbolts' at the D23 Expo panel on Saturday. Actress Florence Pugh and actor Sebastian Stan are set to feature in the film. Actor David Harbour will also be a part of the film. Except for Pugh, the whole cast of the film was present at the event.

38.title: Being underdogs helped SL to play fearless brand of cricket in Asia Cup: Jaffer
38.article_body: Talking about Sri Lanka's performance after they reached Asia Cup 2022 final, Wasim Jaffer said Sri Lanka played brilliant cricket and peaked at the right time after losing their first match against Afghanistan. "Being underdogs in the tournament helped Sri Lanka to play a fearless brand of cricket," he added. Sri Lanka are on a four-match winning streak.

39.title: Govt sets petrol, diesel prices on basis of election dates: Cong
39.article_body: Alleging that the government reduces or freezes the petrol and diesel prices during elections, Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh said, "Petrol and diesel prices are regulated by election dates and not global rates." He asked why citizens had to bear high fuel prices when crude oil prices were at a seven-month low. Vallabh added that consistently high retail inflation is concerning.

40.title: KRK deletes his 'vengeance' tweet, says 'I've forgotten whatever bad happened with me'
40.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan deleted his "I'm back for my vengeance" tweet which he had posted after being released from jail on bail. He later tweeted, "Media is creating new stories. I'm back and safe at my home. I don’t need any revenge from anyone. I've forgotten whatever bad thing happened with me. I believe...it was written in my destiny."

41.title: Felt something in my gut when I read 'Causeway' script: Lawrence
41.article_body: Actress Jennifer Lawrence said she felt something in her gut when she read the script of 'Causeway'. Speaking about the feeling, she said, "That kind of immediate, 'We have to make this'." Jennifer has acted and produced the film. "I identify with that feeling of trying to find your home...I left home when I was 14," she further stated.

42.title: Pakistan's Shadab, Asif collide while attempting catch, ball goes for a six; video viral
42.article_body: Pakistan's Shadab Khan and Asif Ali collided near the boundary while attempting a catch during their Asia Cup 2022 final against Sri Lanka. On the last delivery of Sri Lanka's 19th over, Bhanuka Rajapaksa lofted the ball towards deep mid-wicket, where both Asif and Shadab went for the catch. Asif mistakenly parried ball over for a six amid the collision.

43.title: Mahesh Babu, Jr NTR condole Krishnam Raju's demise
43.article_body: Celebrities including Mahesh Babu and Jr NTR took to Twitter to express grief over the demise of veteran actor and former Union Minister Krishnam Raju. "A very sad day for me," Mahesh wrote, adding that his life, work and immense contribution to cinema will always be remembered. "Deeply saddened...I extend my heartfelt condolences to his family," Jr NTR tweeted.

44.title: Fans wearing India jersey denied entry to Asia Cup final, Bharat Army shares video
44.article_body: Fans wearing India jersey were denied entry to the Dubai International Cricket Stadium for the Asia Cup 2022 final between Pakistan and Sri Lanka. The Bharat Army, the official Team India supporters group, shared a video to share their ordeal. "We were asked to go out. They even pushed us," a fan stated.

45.title: Organisers surprise Świątek by putting tiramisu inside her US Open trophy, video viral
45.article_body: US Open 2022 organisers surprised women's singles champion Iga Świątek by putting tiramisu inside her US Open trophy. A video of the same has gone viral. The organisers asked her to open up top of the trophy. Świątek then found out tiramisu was kept inside it. After winning the final, Świątek had said she'd celebrate with a lot of tiramisu.

46.title: Countrymade bombs explode during BJP's rally in Bengal; 2 injured
46.article_body: Several country made bombs allegedly exploded during a protest rally organised by the BJP in Sitalkuchi area of West Bengal's Cooch Behar district. As per reports, at least two BJP workers, who sustained injuries in the incident, have been admitted to a district hospital. Following the incident, a police team was reportedly deployed to bring the situation under control.

47.title: It annoyed me: Dogecoin co-creator on Musk sending Doge-1 to the Moon
47.article_body: Dogecoin co-creator Jackson Palmer said he was "kind of annoyed" when billionaire Elon Musk attempted to send a crypto-themed satellite called Doge 1 "to the Moon" last year. Palmer said he's grown tired of being "dragged" into conversations about Dogecoin. "Even when I had completely deleted all social media, [conversations about Dogecoin] continued to follow me," he added.

48.title: RPF personnel helps specially-abled passenger board train in TN; video surfaces
48.article_body: IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a video on Twitter showing a Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel helping a specially-abled passenger board a train at Tamil Nadu's Virudhachalam station. "Wonderful gesture by Saravanan, Sub-Inspector, RPF...We need more people like him," Sahu wrote. "Carrying passenger like this is risky for both passenger and Sub-Inspector," Asian Para Games gold medallist Ekta Bhyan wrote.

49.title: Over 5 cr items are bought for gifting during Diwali season: CAIT
49.article_body: Traders' body CAIT has said over five crore items are purchased for gifting during every Diwali season. CAIT urged people to buy souvenirs inscribed with 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav', celebrating 75 years of Independence. "CAIT through its [over] 40,000 affiliate associations will connect with, potters...startups...and others to...produce a variety of quality products at affordable prices," it said.

50.title: Kangana Ranaut remembers J Jayalalithaa on one year of 'Thalaivii'
50.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to share a post marking one year since the release of her film 'Thalaivii'. "As Thalaivii completes one year remembering the iconic leader Purchai Thalaivi Dr J Jayalalithaa," she wrote, while sharing a still from the film. Directed by AL Vijay, it was based on the life of former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa.

51.title: Indian Railways revenue up 38% to ₹95,486.58 crore till Aug-end
51.article_body: Railways Ministry has said the overall revenue of Indian Railways at the end of August 2022 was ₹95,486.58 crore. This is over 38% or ₹26,271.29 crore as compared to the corresponding period of last year, an official statement said. Further, the revenue from passenger traffic increased 116% year-on-year to ₹25,276.54 crore. Passenger traffic has also increased compared to last year.

52.title: Ailing activist Atikur Rahman’s mother demands his release
52.article_body: Activist Atikur Rahman's mother has demanded his release from jail, saying that she was "concerned for his life". Rahman was arrested in 2020 en route to Hathras, along with journalist Siddique Kappan, and at the time was receiving treatment for a heart condition. His wife, Sanjida, asked the judiciary to step in and grant him bail owing to his ill-health.

53.title: PM Modi to attend SCO summit in Uzbekistan on Sept 15-16
53.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will visit Samarkand in Uzbekistan to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit on September 15 and 16, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Sunday. Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin are among the leaders expected at the meeting. PM Modi is likely to hold bilateral meetings on the sidelines of the Summit.

54.title: Minor boy from UP seeks SC permission to donate liver to father
54.article_body: A minor boy in Uttar Pradesh filed a plea in the Supreme Court seeking permission to donate his liver to his father, who is currently critically ill. Only adults and deceased minors can donate organs, as per The Transplantation of Human Organs Act, 1994. The apex court has issued a notice to the UP government over the boy's plea.

55.title: We expect from Haaland what we expected from Ronaldo, Messi: Saha
55.article_body: Talking about Erling Haaland, ex-Manchester United striker Louis Saha said everyone expects the same results from the Manchester City forward what they expected from Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi for their respective teams for a long time. "For me, that's great. It's great for world football," he added. Haaland has scored 10 goals in six Premier League appearances so far.

56.title: US planes with relief material land in Pakistan's Sindh province
56.article_body: Two US military aircraft carrying relief supplies for those affected by the recent floods in Pakistan landed at Sukkur Airport in Sindh province on Sunday, Pakistani authorities said. Each plane brought in around 35 tons of relief aid, authorities added. It is estimated that millions have been left homeless by the floods that have battered Pakistan since mid-June.

57.title: Ranveer Singh dances on 'Pushpa' song at SIIMA 2022, video viral
57.article_body: A video of Ranveer Singh dancing to the song 'Srivalli' from the film 'Pushpa: The Rise' at the South Indian International Movie Awards (SIIMA) 2022 has gone viral on social media. In another video, Ranveer also recited Allu Arjun's dialogue from the film. Reacting to Ranveer's dance, a fan wrote on Instagram, "Is he a man or a glucose bottle?"

58.title: Indigenous stealth guided-missile frigate 'Taragiri' launched
58.article_body: India's indigenously-designed Nilgiri-class stealth guided-missile frigate 'Taragiri' has been launched on Sunday. It is the third stealth frigate built as part of Project 17A, under which a series of such frigates are being constructed. The 149-metre-long ship is propelled by two gas turbines and two main diesel engines and will be fitted with a supersonic surface-to-surface missile system.

59.title: Man picks up sleeping 3-year-old from house in MP, rapes her
59.article_body: A three-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a man who picked her up while she was asleep in her house at a village in Madhya Pradesh's Katni district on Sunday, police said. Villagers claimed that a man who worked in a cement factory and lived in the neighbourhood had committed the crime, he added.

60.title: 6 dead after U'khand panchayat poll candidate distributes hooch
60.article_body: At least six people have died in the last three days after allegedly consuming illicit liquor distributed by a panchayat election candidate in Uttarakhand, Haridwar SP (Rural) Parmendra Singh Dobhal said. "Two more deaths have been reported in the concerned villages, but we cannot confirm if these are liquor-related deaths," Dobhal added. The candidate's husband has been arrested.

61.title: Group of men beat up doctor, his son for opening clinic door late in Maha, video surfaces
61.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a group of men beating up a doctor and his son for opening the clinic door late in Maharashtra's Baramati. The men were reportedly related to a patient. The police has registered a case against four people for the assault. A probe into the doctor's complaint is underway.

62.title: Songs 'Teri Ore', 'Dus Bahane' were shot in 6 hrs: Choreographer Bosco
62.article_body: Bollywood choreographer Bosco Martis revealed songs 'Dus Bahane' from 'Dus' and 'Teri Ore' from 'Singh Is Kinng' were shot in six hours. "'Teri Ore' was done in six hours, with Katrina Kaif changing, we were in Egypt, we had to shoot the pyramids...there was a lot to shoot," he said. "It's funny that they became popular," he further added.

63.title: It's funny: Uma Bharti on Kamal Nath's invite to join 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
63.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti on Sunday said she finds Congress leader Kamal Nath's invite for her to join the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' "funny". "I read in a newspaper that Kamal Nathji has invited me to join the Bharat Jodo Yatra...I am not used to such jokes," Bharti said. Congress has no right to undertake such a march, she added.

64.title: India demonstrated resilience in face of global energy crisis: Puri
64.article_body: India has demonstrated great resilience in the face of a global energy crisis, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. He further said fuel price rise in India has been contained in comparison to an exponential rise in developed countries. "Most...developed nations...[saw]...inflation rise in gasoline price by...40% [in] July-Aug' 22, while...India's gasoline price...reduced by 2.12%," he added.

65.title: Horse bred by Queen Elizabeth II wins race in US' Baltimore
65.article_body: A horse bred by Queen Elizabeth II won a race in US' Baltimore on Saturday, two days after the British monarch died. West Newton, a six-year-old gelding, rallied from sixth place to win by a half-length, his fourth victory in 19 races. Meanwhile, British horse racing resumed today after meetings were suspended for two days as a mark of respect.

66.title: Rejected 'Ponniyin...' as I wasn't in mental state to do it: Amala Paul
66.article_body: Actress Amala Paul revealed director Mani Ratnam took her audition for his film 'Ponniyin Selvan', however, she added that the film didn't happen at that time. "Then in 2021, he called me for the same project...I was not in the mental state to do it, so I had to turn it down," she added. The film will feature actor Vikram.

67.title: Article 370 can't be restored, won't mislead people: Ghulam Nabi Azad
67.article_body: Former J&K CM Ghulam Nabi Azad said Article 370, which granted special status to the erstwhile state, cannot be restored. Azad added he will not allow political parties to exploit people in the name of the revoked Act. The former Congress leader said he will not mislead people as restoring the Act requires a two-thirds majority in Parliament.

68.title: Golden time to invest in India: Goyal to business community in US
68.article_body: Interacting with the business community of Southern California, Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said this is a golden time to invest in India. Goyal further invited them all to be a part of India's journey towards becoming a developed nation. India as an economy in 2047 can be seen as a powerhouse driving global growth, he added.

69.title: Gained weight to get noticed by casting directors for plus-size roles: Soma
69.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actress Soma Rathod revealed that she was rejected in several auditions because she was "neither too thin nor too fat". "I gained weight to get noticed by casting directors for plus-size roles that aren't so common in our industry," Soma said, adding, "Being overweight, I've the benefit of roles specifically written with me in mind."

70.title: Improper that Maha CM Shinde and CJI UU Lalit shared a stage: MVA
70.article_body: The MVA alliance said it was "improper" and not "per protocol" that CJI UU Lalit shared a stage with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde while the SC is hearing a case against him. Alliance leaders said this should not have happened while "legitimacy and legality of the Shinde government is being examined". The CJI was felicitated at the event on Saturday.

71.title: PM Modi's revdi culture of making VP: Congress on Malik's comment
71.article_body: Responding to Meghalaya governor Satya Pal Malik claiming he could have been Vice President if he stopped speaking against the government, the Congress said this was an example of PM Modi's "revdi culture". "Wah Modiji wah. You turned out to be a great artist. This is Modiji's freebie," said Congress. Malik had said that he will speak what he "feels".

72.title: Honoured & grateful: Kartik on winning Best Actor at OTTplay Awards
72.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan bagged the 'Best Actor' award for his role in 'Dhamaka' at the OTTplay Awards on Saturday. The actor took to Instagram to share a post after winning the award and wrote, "Best Actor #Dhamaka !! Thank you #HtOttAwards for recognising #ArjunPathak. Honoured and Grateful." Kartik played a reporter named Arjun Pathak in the film.

73.title: Uddhav's style of functioning responsible for split in Sena: Fadnavis
73.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis took a jibe at former CM Uddhav Thackeray, saying that his style of functioning was responsible for the split in the Shiv Sena. He also admitted that believing senior NCP leader Ajit Pawar was his "biggest" political blunder. "Uddhav Thackeray made a mockery of the mandate," Fadnavis added.

74.title: Army Chief Gen Manoj Pande flies in Apache helicopter on Ladakh visit
74.article_body: Indian Army Chief General Manoj Pande flew in an Indian Air Force Apache attack helicopter in the Ladakh sector on Sunday. The AH-64E Apache helicopter is equipped with the latest communications, navigation, sensor and weapon systems. General Pande reviewed the overall security situation in eastern Ladakh on the first day of his two-day visit to the Union Territory on Saturday.

75.title: Mali's leader demands 'compensation' for release of Ivorian soldiers
75.article_body: Mali's Interim President Assimi Goita has demanded "compensation" for Mali as part of resolution of an ongoing diplomatic conflict with Ivory Coast, state media reported. Ivory Coast has been calling for the release of 46 Ivorian soldiers in Mali's custody. Goita linked his demand with the fact that Ivory Coast has granted asylum to political figures wanted by Mali's junta.

76.title: When did I insult Hindu culture: Kamra to VHP on show cancellation
76.article_body: Two days after a bar in Gurugram cancelled comedian Kunal Kamra's show after members of the Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) threatened to protest, Kamra on Sunday wrote a letter to VHP. "When did I disrespect Hindu culture? If there is any clip or show, please show it to me as well," he wrote in the letter.

77.title: Prabhas breaks down after uncle Krishnam Raju's death, pic surfaces
77.article_body: Actor Prabhas broke down after the demise of his uncle, veteran actor and former Union Minister Krishnam Raju. Pictures and videos of him breaking down at the late actor's residence have surfaced online. Veteran actor Chiranjeevi can be seen consoling Prabhas and holding his hand. As per PTI, Krishnam Raju was suffering from post-COVID-19 ailments.

78.title: Security increased in Varanasi ahead of court order on Gyanvapi case
78.article_body: Ahead of the Varanasi district court's order on the Gyanvapi mosque case on Monday, prohibitory orders were put in place and security was tightened in the city. Both Hindu and Muslim sides concluded their arguments on the maintainability of the suit in August. Police have intensified checking in the district's border areas, hotels and guest houses.

79.title: Specially-abled Swiggy delivery agent delivers food in motorised wheelchair, video viral
79.article_body: A video of a specially-abled Swiggy delivery agent using a motorised wheelchair to deliver food has gone viral on social media. The video was reposted on Twitter by Swati Maliwal, Chairperson of Delhi Commission for Women, who praised the Swiggy delivery agent. "Of course life is difficult, but we have learned never to give up...Salute to this spirit," Maliwal wrote.

80.title: Future of women's tennis burns brightly: Billie Jean on Iga-Ons US Open final
80.article_body: Former tennis player Billie Jean King took to Twitter following Iga Swiatek's US Open win and wrote, "Congratulations to Iga Swiatek, the first Polish woman to win the US Open. And cheers to Ons Jabeur on an incredible battle." She added, "Future of women's tennis burns so brightly." Ex-Polish player Agnieszka Radwanska tweeted, "You just rock it!! Huge congratulations Swiatek."

81.title: Would never change anything about my journey: Actor Kartik Aaryan
81.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said that he will never change anything about his journey. "Thankfully I started when I was 20, almost like a child artist, but it's been a journey with ups and downs and I've seen hits and flops," he stated. Kartik added that he is enjoying the success of his recent films 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Dhamaka'.

82.title: Google Play Store’s new app review policy to bring more genuine reviews: Report
82.article_body: Google is reportedly bringing a new app review policy to make app ratings and reviews on Play Store more genuine. Under the policy, user-submitted reviews and ratings will be held up by around 24 hours before they go public. Google also warned against posting the same review multiple times as well as reviews for the same content from multiple accounts.

83.title: Indian cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy gets engaged to weightlifting coach, shares pics
83.article_body: India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy got engaged to performance coach and weightlifting coach Arjun Hoysala. The duo took to Instagram to share pictures, with Arjun writing, "And, she said 'Yes'." Arjun has also played a first-class match for Karnataka and has represented Belagavi Panthers in Karnataka Premier League.

84.title: Kareena praises 'Brahmastra', calls it an 'unbelievable experience'
84.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to Instagram Stories and praised Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "Unbelievable experience (five stars). Well done to the entire team," she wrote. Kareena watched the film with her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan and their son Taimur on Friday. The film has been released in five languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam.

85.title: Man throws slipper at mosque in Karnataka, video surfaces
85.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man throwing a slipper at a local mosque in Karnataka's Ballari district. Alok Kumar, Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, Karnataka, tweeted that the accused had been taken into custody. "Appropriate legal action is being taken against them," Kumar said.

86.title: WB CM Mamata says she's poor, but uses iPhone worth lakhs: BJP
86.article_body: BJP national vice president Dilip Ghosh took a jibe at West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and Abhishek Banerjee, for claiming to be poor, but using iPhones "worth lakhs of rupees". "Remember what 'Didimoni' (Mamata Banerjee) said? Talk on FaceTime. FaceTime is only available on iPhones. How many of you use FaceTime?" Ghosh said during a public meeting.

87.title: Soldier martyred as parachute fails to open during exercise in Leh
87.article_body: Paratrooper Naik Suraj Pal on Sunday was martyred after his parachute failed to open during a mountain strike exercise in the Leh-Ladakh region. "We salute the resolute courage of the paratrooper and stand by his family in this hour of grief," Indian Army's Central Command stated. Last week, a commando was martyred in a similar exercise in the Leh sector.

88.title: Salman's Mumbai house was recced by Sidhu Moosewala murder accused: Police
88.article_body: An accused in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case conducted a recce of actor Salman Khan's house in Mumbai on gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's instruction, police have said. This was revealed by the accused Kapil Pandit during his interrogation, Punjab Police DGP Gaurav Yadav said. A threat letter was sent to Salman and his father Salim in June this year.

89.title: PM condoles demise of Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swaroopanand Saraswati
89.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his grief at the demise of Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati on Sunday. "My condolences to his followers in this time of grief. Om Shanti!" PM Modi said. Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati passed away at the age of 98 at the Shridham Jhoteshwar Ashram in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur.

90.title: 20-yr-old strangled to death by father over her romantic relationship in UP
90.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death by her father for having a romantic relationship with a man in Uttar Pradesh's Jhinjhana, police said. The victim had eloped with her boyfriend and returned home after a few days. The father has confessed that he committed the crime as he felt his daughter had tarnished the name of his family.

91.title: Turkey says Greek Coast Guard fired on cargo ship amid tensions
91.article_body: A cargo ship sailing in international waters in the Aegean Sea came under fire from two Greek Coast Guard vessels on Saturday, the Turkish Coast Guard said. No casualties due to the shooting were reported. Lately, there has been a flare up in tensions between Greece and Turkey over Greek military deployment on several islands near the Turkish coast.

92.title: Challenge you to an open discussion on corruption: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
92.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Sunday challenged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to an "open discussion on corruption". "We are always ready. You fix the time and venue, and we will come," Siddaramaiah said.  "BJP leaders are claiming that they will expose scandals of our time. I challenge them to do that. I am ready to face it," he added.

93.title: Pakistan to bowl first in Asia Cup 2022 final against SL, playing XIs announced
93.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam won the toss and elected to bowl first against Sri Lanka in the Asia Cup 2022 final in Dubai. Pakistan have made two changes to their playing XI, with Shadab Khan and Naseem Shah returning to the side in place of Usman Qadir and Hasan Ali. Sri Lanka are fielding the same playing XI.

94.title: When I worked in Telugu films, actresses were for love scenes, songs: Amala
94.article_body: Actress Amala Paul, who worked in four Telugu films between 2011 and 2015, revealed that she could not connect with the Telugu film industry. "The kind of films that they were making...was very different. There would always be two actresses and we'd be there for the love scenes, songs," she added. "Everything was very glamorous," she further stated.

95.title: PM Modi is 'soul of country', can't be defeated: Maha Minister Khade
95.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Suresh Khade has claimed PM Narendra Modi was the "soul of the country" and was "undefeatable". "Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Indira Gandhi lost elections in their time, but Modi will never lose," Khade asserted. PM Modi lies in the hearts of the people of India, Khade further added.

96.title: Pune district reports 5 COVID-19 deaths during Ganesh Chaturthi
96.article_body: The Pune district reported five COVID-19 deaths during the 10-day-long Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. Health department officials said that due to the festivities, daily cases may rise over the next few days. Dr Pradeep Awate, state surveillance officer, urged people to wear masks and said, "At present, a subvariant of Omicron BA.2.75 is dominating other covid variants in the state."

97.title: Will soon launch national party, formulate its policies: T'gana CM
97.article_body: Telangana CM and TRS chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said he would launch a national party and formulate its policies soon. "There has been a consensus on the alternative national agenda after prolonged discussions with intellectuals, economists and experts from various fields like we did before the start of [the] Telangana movement," an official release from Rao's office said.

98.title: Pune Police recieve 1,043 noise complaints during Ganpati festival
98.article_body: The Pune Police received 1,043 noise complaints between August 31 and September 10, and the highest number of complaints were received on September 9, the final day of the Ganpati festival. Majority of the complaints were about loud music at Ganesh pandals beyond the 10 pm deadline. Police Commissioner, Amitabh Gupta, said that appropriate action will be taken.

99.title: IMD issues yellow alert for Mumbai predicting rains over next 2 days
99.article_body: The IMD has issued a fresh yellow alert for Mumbai predicting heavy rainfall with thunderstorms over the next two days. The department added that the temperatures in the city will increase, despite the rains. Meteorologists say Mumbai has recorded 174 mm of rain this month until September 9, which is comparatively on the lighter side.

100.title: Liberian national arrested for trafficking 3 Mumbai men to Myanmar
100.article_body: A Liberian national was arrested by Mumbai's Bandra Police for duping three people with job offers and getting them trafficked. Police say the man promised the three men a job in Thailand but once they reached there, their passports were confiscated and they were held captive inside a bunker in Myanmar. The MEA is currently working on getting them back.

101.title: 2 sisters jump from 11th floor of building in Noida; 1 dies
101.article_body: Two sisters allegedly jumped from the eleventh floor of a building in Noida's Sector-96 on Saturday, police said. The elder sister, aged around 18, died on the spot, while her younger sister, aged 17, was shifted to a hospital. Both of them reportedly got into a dispute with their family members and left the house before jumping off the building.

102.title: Rajpath erased from signboards near India Gate after being renamed
102.article_body: The old name of New Delhi's ceremonial avenue, Rajpath, has been taken off the signages mounted around the periphery of the India Gate hexagon after it was renamed 'Kartavya Path'. The move comes after the civic body recently issued a notice approving the renaming of the historic road at its special meeting on September 7.

103.title: Viral video shows King Charles gesturing angrily to aide to clear his desk
103.article_body: A video showing UK's King Charles III gesturing angrily to his aide to clear the desk during his accession ceremony has gone viral online. The 73-year-old is seen in the video prompting his aide to remove a tray of pens from his desk. He was proclaimed the King at the ceremony in St James's Palace, London.

104.title: Assam Congress leader Kamrul Islam Choudhury resigns from party
104.article_body: Assam Pradesh Congress Committee (APCC) General Secretary Kamrul Islam Choudhury resigned from the party's primary membership on Sunday. In a letter to party chief Sonia Gandhi, he said the present instability of Congress in Assam due to directionless and confused leadership of APCC during the last few months has left no reason for him to continue as the party's member.

105.title: Alia shares videos of audiences throwing confetti during Brahmastra screening
105.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to her Instagram Stories and re-posted a couple of videos showing viewers throwing confetti during the screening of 'Brahmastra' in theatres. In a video, fans could be seen cheering and throwing confetti as 'Allari Motha', the Telugu version of 'Dance Ka Bhoot', played on the screen. According to makers, 'Brahmastra' has collected ₹160 crore globally.

106.title: Was extremely nervous: Shiamak Davar recalls meeting Queen Elizabeth II
106.article_body: Choreographer Shiamak Davar, condoling the demise of Queen Elizabeth II, said, "I'd heard she was ailing. When she passed away, I felt very sad." He also recalled meeting the Queen in 2017 and said he was "extremely nervous". "I was wondering what I should wear...Though it was formal, I made it Indian because I'm proud to be Indian," said Shiamak.

107.title: 2 interstate drug peddlers arrested in Hyd, 1 litre of hash oil seized
107.article_body: Hyderabad's Vanasthalipuram Police on September 9 arrested two interstate drug peddlers from Sushma crossroads. The accused purchased 1 litre of hash oil from a drug dealer in Visakhapatnam for ₹40,000. The police arrested them while the two were waiting to board a bus to Hyderabad. The accused concealed the hash oil container in a bag to evade the police.

108.title: Delhi Police van rams into scooty, accused of destroying evidence; 2 hurt
108.article_body: A video showing a Delhi Police van ramming into a scooty and injuring two women has surfaced online. The women have alleged that the police personnel were in an inebriated condition and also tried to wipe the blood off the road to destroy incriminating evidence. They also offered money to the victims to not lodge a complaint, reports said.

109.title: 3 killed as US-made Black Hawk crashes during Taliban exercise
109.article_body: A US-made Black Hawk helicopter crashed during a training exercise in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Saturday, killing three Afghan crew members, the Taliban's Defence Ministry said. Another five people were injured in the incident, the ministry added. Several US-manufactured military equipment, including helicopters, were seized by the Taliban after US forces withdrew from Afghanistan last year.

110.title: Sky is the limit: World no. 1 Swiatek after her maiden US Open win
110.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek said the "sky is the limit" after winning her maiden US Open title. "It's something that I wasn't expecting for sure...I'm proud, also surprised a little bit. Just happy that I was able to do that," she added. Swiatek beat Ons Jabeur 6-2, 7-6(7-5) in final. Overall, it was the 21-year-old's third Grand Slam title.

111.title: Kejriwal, corruption synonymous; he has no right to remain CM: BJP
111.article_body: The BJP on Sunday alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and corruption have become synonymous, adding that he has no right to remain in the post. "How can you claim to be 'hardcore honest'? People have understood you are 'hardcore corrupt'. You have no right to remain in the chair of the CM," said BJP's national spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

112.title: Blindly adopting tech could be counterproductive: RBI Executive Director
112.article_body: The Executive Director of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Ajay Choudhary, said that the financial sector "blindly" adopting latest technologies without understanding the biases could be counterproductive. "RBI’s focus area is innovation, while innovations are desirable they also need to be responsible," he added. Choudhary said that the risks posed by new innovations should be well understood.

113.title: Akhtar shares 'BP monitor, inhaler, tablets' meme ahead of Pak-SL final, says 'All ready?'
113.article_body: Ahead of the Pakistan-Sri Lanka Asia Cup 2022 final, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to share a meme showing a BP monitoring device, an inhaler and tablets with the caption, "All set for Asia Cup 2022 final". Akhtar wrote, "Sab tayyar? (All ready?)" A fan jokingly commented, "Get ready to break TVs as well."

114.title: I tell daughter Palak not to marry, I don't believe in it: Shweta Tiwari
114.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari revealed she tells her daughter Palak Tiwari not to get married. Shweta added she doesn't believe in the institution of marriage. Shweta has divorced Raja Chaudhary and Abhinav Kohli in the past. "I want her to think well before taking the plunge. Just because you're in a relationship, it doesn't have to culminate into marriage," she stated.

115.title: Sorry state of affairs: HC to Delhi govt on plea of kids suffering from cerebral palsy
115.article_body: Delhi High Court has warned the AAP-led Delhi government of action over the plea of two children, seeking support under disabilities law. Terming it a sorry state of affairs, Justice Gaurang Kanth said it "miserably failed" to carry out its duty as "State" towards the children. He noted the Delhi government "wasn't in a position to consider" their case positively.

116.title: Man kills wife with frying pan in Noida for refusing to cook food
116.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his wife with a frying pan in their house at Shramik Kunj in Noida's sector 66 area on Saturday morning, after she refused to cook food for him. The couple was alone in the house when the incident took place, reports said. The couple's neighbour informed the police about the crime.

117.title: Delhi needs more educated LG: AAP as LG approves CBI probe in alleged bus scam
117.article_body: After Delhi LG VK Saxena approved a CBI probe into the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by Delhi Transport Corporation, AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said, "Delhi needs a more educated LG." "[He] has no clue what he's signing on," Bharadwaj said. "[He's] facing many serious allegations of corruption...To divert attention, he's making such enquiries," Bharadwaj added.

118.title: Reliance can explore reorganisation to list subsidiaries: Report
118.article_body: A Kotak Institutional Equities report has said that Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd can explore the reorganisation of the company into three independent entities for different verticals to list subsidiaries. It added that this would help prevent any holding company discount in Reliance as and when it lists subsidiaries. It would also help Reliance prepare for eventual management change.

119.title: I wasn't even considered for my role in 'Jersey': Prit Kamani
119.article_body: Actor Prit Kamani, speaking about his role in 'Jersey', has said that he was not even considered in 'Jersey' as he was already playing the lead in other projects. "For me, no role is big or small...'Jersey' is a special film since I am very close to my father as I wanted to give something back to him," he stated.

120.title: US Open champ Iga's tweet on spotting 'Friends' actor Perry during final goes viral
120.article_body: World number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek's tweet on spotting 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry during the US Open 2022 final has gone viral. Sharing a GIF of Perry's character 'Chandler Bing' from Friends, Iga wrote, "Me when I really wanted to be focused but I saw @MatthewPerry on the screen during the changeover. Could this BE any more exciting?"

121.title: They are not letting the model set: Ramiz Raja on India not reaching Asia Cup final
121.article_body: Talking about India failing to reach Asia Cup 2022 final, Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said, "India went down only because they are not letting the model set. They are making too many changes." He added, "They have a bigger pool of players with which they are experimenting." He further attributed Pakistan's success to not changing the winning model.

122.title: Wonderful that we don't live in time where language is barrier: Ranveer
122.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh won the Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India award at the South Indian International Movie Awards (SIIMA). While receiving the award, Ranveer said, "There used to be a time when language was a barrier, but how wonderful it is that we don't live in such a time anymore." Actor Allu Arjun won the Best Actor award.

123.title: Link startups with industry as equal stakeholders: Jitendra Singh
123.article_body: In order to ensure sustainable startups, Minister of State for Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh, said that startups and industry should be linked from the beginning as equal stakeholders. He added that his Ministry was reaching out to startups and providing seed funding for incubation and quality research. Singh also said that India currently ranks third in the startup ecosystem.

124.title: 14 gold bars weighing over 2 kg seized from Assam bus, 3 held
124.article_body: In a joint operation, Assam Police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) arrested three people and seized 14 gold bars weighing 2.323 kg from a passenger bus in Karbi Anglong district on Saturday night. A naka checking was set up by the police and CRPF personnel at the Lahorijan area based on secret information.

125.title: Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati passes away aged 98
125.article_body: Dwarka Peeth Shankaracharya Swami Swaroopanand Saraswati passed away aged 98 on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur. He had inherited the title of Shankaracharya of Dwarka in 1982. He had become a freedom fighter in the Quit India movement in 1942 and was known as 'Revolutionary Sadhu'. In 1950, he had become a 'dandi sanyasi'.

126.title: He's a great player and a star: Liverpool's Firmino on teammate Carvalho
126.article_body: Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino praised teammate Fabio Carvalho, saying the 20-year-old is a great player. "I confess that I had watched some of his games before he came to Liverpool, so I was already impressed by the way he played," he added. "He's a star...he's also a very close friend," Firmino further said. Carvalho joined Liverpool from Fulham in July.

127.title: WhatsApp may soon allow users to search messages by date: Report
127.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature that will allow users to search for a message by date, WABetaInfo reported. A 'calendar' icon will reportedly appear when a user searches for a message in a conversation. Upon clicking it, the user will be able to jump to a certain date and read all messages in the conversation received on that date.

128.title: Ranveer Singh named Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India at SIIMA 2022
128.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh was named the Most Popular Hindi Actor in South India at the South Indian International Movie Awards 2022 (SIIMA). The award ceremony was held in Bangalore on September 10. The awards for Telugu and Kannada films were announced on Saturday, while Tamil and Malayalam winners will be awarded tonight.

129.title: Ready with full force: Kapil on new season of ‘The Kapil Sharma Show’
129.article_body: Comedian-turned-actor Kapil Sharma said the team of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' is "ready with full force" to bring some entertainment in its new season. Kapil said, during the break, he had "a lot of time to introspect" on what new elements he can bring to the show. The first episode of the new season aired on September 10.

130.title: Discussion on B'luru flood likely to make Karnataka Assembly session stormy
130.article_body: Karnataka Legislature's Monsoon Session, starting Monday, is likely to be stormy as the Opposition is ready to raise issues like Bengaluru floods and infrastructure problems. Damage caused by rains and floods is expected to be discussed. Leader of the Opposition Siddaramaiah recently demanded a white paper regarding the clearing of encroachments and infrastructural worries in Bengaluru.

131.title: Enjoyed 'Brahmastra', second part is going to be huge: Hansal Mehta
131.article_body: Director Hansal Mehta took to Twitter to share that he "really enjoyed" watching 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' at the theatre. "So much respect for the passion and perseverance of Ayan Mukerji," he wrote, adding, "I really hope this film works wonders." He also mentioned that the film's sequel, officially titled 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev', "is going to be huge".

132.title: Stuck in Bengaluru traffic, doctor runs 3 km to reach OT on time
132.article_body: A Bengaluru-based doctor, who was getting late for his surgery because of the traffic, abandoned his car and ran to the hospital to reach the operation theatre (OT) on time. Gastroenterology surgeon Dr Govind Nandakumar was en route to Manipal Hospital for the emergency laparoscopic gallbladder surgery. "I ran three [kilometre] to hospital and was in time for...surgery," he said.

133.title: Abhishek Banerjee's relative stopped from flying, summoned by ED
133.article_body: Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee's sister-in-law Maneka Gambhir was stopped at Kolkata airport when she was about to travel to Bangkok. She was informed that she wasn't allowed to travel out of India since a look out notice was issued against her by Enforcement Directorate. Gambhir has been summoned by ED in connection with the coal smuggling scam on Monday.

134.title: Steven Spielberg's memoir 'The Fabelmans' debuts at Toronto Film Fest
134.article_body: Steven Spielberg's autobiographical film 'The Fabelmans' debuted at the Toronto International Film Festival. Spielberg said the memoir, which he clarified isn't his "swan song", was something he had thought about for a long time. He said 'The Fabelmans' was worth making as it brought him closer to his sisters. He also called it a way of bringing his parents back.

135.title: US marks 21st anniversary of 9/11 terror attacks
135.article_body: US President Joe Biden will mark the 21st anniversary of the 9/11 terror attacks. Victims' relatives and dignitaries will assemble at the World Trade Centre in New York, the Pentagon and a field in Pennsylvania where hijacked jets crashed in 2001. The New York City Police Department tweeted, "We...continue to lose [brothers and sisters] from 9/11-related illnesses.''

136.title: To go with Chahar would be beneficial: Gavaskar on squad for T20 WC
136.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said pacer Deepak Chahar should be included in India's squad for the upcoming T20 WC in Australia. "There will be extra bounce with the kind of movement that Deepak generates with the new ball. He's somebody who's got to factor in," stated Gavaskar. Chahar played against Afghanistan in Asia Cup and conceded 28 runs.

137.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' successful beyond our expectations: KC Venugopal
137.article_body: Congress leader KC Venugopal on Sunday said that so far the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has been "successful beyond our expectations". Furthermore, he said, "We didn't imagine Tamil Nadu would give such a grand reception to this yatra." "It shows that this yatra is going to be the most historic yatra India has ever seen," he stated.

138.title: This is Modiji's freebie: Congress on Satya Pal Malik's 'Vice President' claim
138.article_body: The Congress party reacted to Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik's claim that people had indicated him that he would be made the Vice President if he stopped speaking against the central government and said, "This is Modiji's freebie." "Wah Modiji wah. You turned out to be a great artiste," the Congress wrote on its Twitter handle.

139.title: Warning issued for intense spell of rainfall over several states, list released
139.article_body: An intense spell of rainfall is likely over West Bengal, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Vidarbha and East Madhya Pradesh during next three days and over Gujarat and Maharashtra during next five days, as per IMD. Heavy rainfall is also likely in Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Konkan, Goa, Marathwada, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Yanam, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Punjab, East Rajasthan, and South Interior Karnataka.

140.title: Google testing feature to reduce background noise during phone calls: Report
140.article_body: Google is testing the 'Clear Calling' feature to reduce background noise during calls on devices running on the Android 13 QPR1 Beta OS, according to reports. Sharing information about the feature, Twitter user Mishaal Rahman said it works "for most mobile networks" but is "not available for Wi-Fi calling". The feature doesn't send content from calls to Google, Rahman added.

141.title: Clash between Thackeray and Shinde faction in Mumbai, 5 arrested
141.article_body: A clash erupted between two Shiv Sena groups (Uddhav Thackeray faction and Eknath Shinde faction) during Ganesh Visarjan in Mumbai's Dadar area. Police have now arrested five members of Thackeray's faction, and a case has been registered against more than 30 people in the matter. Both faction reportedly clashed over a social media post.

142.title: Odisha village that King Charles visited 42 yrs ago holds prayers for him
142.article_body: Residents of Haripur village in Odisha's Puri district, where King Charles III had visited 42 years ago, have organised a prayer session for him, reports said. A district official said the king was 32 years old when he had visited Haripur to get a feel of village life. "During his visit, Charles enjoyed sipping on coconut water," a resident said.

143.title: Uttarakhand Waqf Board to demolish illegal structures on its land
143.article_body: The Uttarakhand Waqf Board will demolish illegal structures on its properties across the state, the board's new president Shadab Shams said on Sunday. He added that the board's properties worth ₹1.5 lakh crore have been illegally occupied. The Waqf Board will move a proposal to buy or hire bulldozers for the same at its meeting on September 15.

144.title: Small plane with crew and cargo on board goes missing in Congo
144.article_body: A small plane bound for the Kasese airport in Congo with three crew members and some cargo on board failed to reach its destination on Saturday, a provincial minister said on Sunday. A search operation is underway to locate the missing plane, the minister added. Communication with the aircraft was lost after its take-off on Saturday morning, as per authorities.

145.title: Iran's Revolutionary Guards seize foreign ship for smuggling fuel
145.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards have seized a foreign vessel for allegedly smuggling 757,000 litres of diesel out of the country, Iranian state media reported. The ship's seven crew members, all foreign nationals, have reportedly been handed over to legal authorities. Due to highly subsidised fuel prices and a slump in its currency, Iran has been witnessing a rise in fuel smuggling.

146.title: I had indications I will be made VP, if I don't speak against Centre: Satya Pal Malik
146.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has claimed that people had indicated to him that he would be made the Vice President of India if he stopped speaking against the government. "I already had indications that I will be made (Vice President), if I don't speak, but I don't do this, I speak what I feel," he said.

147.title: Avesh would be falling out of favour with Bumrah, Harshal coming back: Uthappa
147.article_body: Indian batter Robin Uthappa has said Avesh Khan would "definitely be falling out of favour" when India's squad for the T20 World Cup is announced. "I think they will go with five fast bowlers...and I think Arshdeep and Deepak Chahar will be the other two outside of Bumrah, Bhuvneshwar and Harshal. Hardik plays as the sixth fast bowler," added Uthappa.

148.title: Kejriwal has no right to remain in CM's chair: BJP on alleged bus scam
148.article_body: Commenting on the alleged corruption in the procurement of 1,000 low-floor buses by DTC, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has no right to remain in CM's chair. "Kejriwal and corruption have become synonymous," Bhatia added. "In Delhi, tenders are prepared by friends of the Kejriwal government," he stated.

149.title: 58 CEOs of top-notch global firms are of Indian-origin: Sitharaman
149.article_body: While addressing the convocation event at IIITDM, Kancheepuram, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that 58 CEOs of top-notch global companies are of Indian-origin. She added that 25% of Silicon Valley startups are managed by Indians. Sitharaman also pointed out that the number of Indian CEOs on S&P's top 500 companies list is only next to the figure from the US.

150.title: 2 criminals stab each other at hospital in Thane, both severely injured
150.article_body: Two criminals stabbed each other with knives and blades in Indira Gandhi Memorial (IGM) hospital in Bhiwandi, Thane and broke equipment and destroyed patient's register on Saturday, IGM hospital's supervisor said. The first criminal went to IGM hospital for treatment, and after getting this information, the second came to attack him in hospital. Both were severely injured during the fight.

151.title: Khap Mahapanchayat held in Haryana to seek CBI probe in Sonali death case
151.article_body: A Khap Mahapanchayat was held in Haryana's Hisar on Sunday, demanding a CBI inquiry into the death of TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat in Goa last month. Sonali's daughter Yashodhara Phogat said, "We have no hopes from the government now, [and we've] received no assurance from them." A post-mortem report had revealed blunt force injury on her body.

152.title: India has over 100 unicorns with total value of $250 bn: Sitharaman
152.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India has more than 100 unicorns with a total value of $250 billion. She added that these unicorns have also managed to raise $63 billion from the capital markets. Sitharaman also stated that it was a matter of pride that 25% of startups in Silicon Valley were managed by people of Indian origin.

153.title: Man puts fake Google ads for Liquor delivery, cheats 200+ people in Delhi
153.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a 23-year-old man for allegedly cheating more than 200 people by putting up fake Google advertisements promising to deliver liquor to their homes. "He used shop names like Jagdish Wines, Discovery Wines, and Lake Forest. He has been doing this for a year. The Google ads would run on YouTube," police added.

154.title: Over 500 quarantined after COVID-19 cases detected in Chinese university
154.article_body: Over 500 people, including 488 students, 19 teachers and five assistants, were sent to quarantine centres after a few coronavirus cases were detected at the Communication University of China in Beijing. All of those quarantined were transferred by bus beginning Friday night. China recorded over 1,000 new cases of domestic transmission on Sunday, the Associated Press reported.

155.title: 3 to 6 months required to drain out floodwater in Pak's Sindh: CM
155.article_body: Pakistan's Sindh CM Murad Ali Shah has said that three to six months will be required to drain out rain and flood water from areas in the province, ARY News reported. Shah also told reporters that at least 12.5 million people have been affected by the floods. On Saturday, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres visited several flood-affected areas in the country.

156.title: Mumbai court refuses to discharge sexual assault accused despite -ve DNA report
156.article_body: A special POCSO court in Mumbai has refused to discharge cousin of a girl who was found pregnant in 2020 and had accused him of assaulting her, despite negative DNA report. Reports said that the victim had later said that he had no sexual relations with her. "Her statement... [from] a few months ago, could not be ignored," court said.

157.title: Won't even sell protein shakes: Amit on turning down alcohol brand ad
157.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh, who recently turned down an endorsement deal for an alcohol brand, has said he will not even "sell" protein shakes as they're not good for health. "Even if they give me billions, I will never take it," he added. "I don't need brands which cause unhappiness to my fans, bad health and addiction," Amit further said.

158.title: He has disappointed me: Gambhir on Pakistan batter Zaman in Asia Cup
158.article_body: Ahead of Asia Cup 2022 final between Pakistan and Sri Lanka, ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir said it is extremely important for Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman to come in form. "Zaman has disappointed me," he added. Zaman has scored 10, 53, 15, 5 and 13 in the ongoing Asia Cup so far. The final will be played in the evening today.

159.title: Pune engineering college student kills 7-yr-old boy after kidnapping him
159.article_body: A 20-year-old student of an engineering college has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and murdering a seven-year-old boy in his housing society in Pune district's Pimpri. The boy was kidnapped when he went out to play with his friends. The accused was allegedly humiliated by the victim's father over his behaviour in the residential society.

160.title: Govt fixes total number of seats in MCD at 250, reserves 42 for SC
160.article_body: Union Home Ministry has issued a formal notification fixing the maximum number of seats of the Councillors in the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) at 250. Of the 250 wards, 42 will be reserved for candidates from the Scheduled Caste category. Earlier, the total number of seats in the MCD, including all the three municipal corporations of Delhi, was 272.

161.title: 126 lakes in B'luru overflowed in Sept due to heavy rains: BBMP
161.article_body: As many as 126 lakes overflowed in Bengaluru since the beginning of September due to heavy rains, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) data. Mahadevapura region is the worst affected with 42 lakes overflowing, followed by Bommanahalli (30 lakes). This could be the first time in several decades that so many lakes have overflowed, BBMP officials said.

162.title: Last reactor at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant halts operation
162.article_body: Ukraine's atomic power operator Energoatom has said that the last reactor at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant has been shut down after the plant was reconnected to the electricity grid. The plant, which has six reactors, was disconnected from the grid last week amidst fighting in the area. Energoatom urged Russia to allow creation of a "demilitarised zone" around Zaporizhzhia plant.

163.title: Woman dies after Redmi 6A explodes at night; YouTuber shares pics of damaged phone
163.article_body: A YouTuber from Haryana has claimed that his aunt died after Xiaomi's Redmi 6A smartphone exploded while she was sleeping at night. "She kept the phone near her face on pillow side and after sometime her phone [exploded]," Manjeet said. Xiaomi said it is trying to get in touch with the affected family and determine the cause of the incident.

164.title: Finished 'Delhi Crime 2' in one & a half days, was stuck to my iPad: Rakul
164.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh in a recent interview was asked to name the last series she binge-watched. The actress named Shefali Shah-starrer 'Delhi Crime 2' and said, "I finished it in 1 and a half days while I was shooting, while I was stuck in traffic, while I [was] coming back." "I was just stuck to my iPad," added Rakul.

165.title: We are ready to bat first if we lose the toss in Asia Cup final: Dasun Shanaka
165.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said his side is ready to bat first if they lose the toss in their Asia Cup 2022 final against Pakistan today. "Toss is very important here, but our batsmen are very good," he stated. Sri Lanka have won all the matches in which they won the toss and opted to field in Asia Cup.

166.title: Will announce a new party in 10 days: Ghulam Nabi Azad in J&K
166.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who had earlier resigned from Congress, on Sunday said that he would announce a new political party in 10 days. Azad was addressing a public meeting in Baramulla, J&K. Earlier, Azad said, "I have not decided upon a name for my party yet. The people of J&K will decide the name and the flag for the party."

167.title: Peon molests 15-yr-old girl in Mumbai school toilet for 2 months
167.article_body: Police have arrested a 35-year-old peon for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl in a school toilet in Mumbai's Grant Road area since July. The accused befriended the victim and threatened her with dire consequences if she informed anyone. According to reports, the accused had taken her number and used to ask her to strip while on a video call.

168.title: 7.6-magnitude earthquake hits eastern Papua New Guinea, 3 dead
168.article_body: A 7.6-magnitude earthquake hit the eastern part of Papua New Guinea on Sunday, leaving three people dead. The earthquake damaged buildings, caused power outages and triggered landslides. Kessy Sawang, a member of parliament, said there are fears of more injuries and deaths due to the earthquake. Prime Minister James Marape expressed concern and urged people to move to higher ground.

169.title: We decided to wait on having a child due to COVID-19: Sonam Kapoor
169.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, speaking about planning to have a child with Anand Ahuja, revealed that they decided to wait during the COVID-19 pandemic as they did not understand much about it. Sonam revealed she told Anand on her birthday in 2021 that they should not wait anymore to have a child. The actress gave birth to a baby boy in August.

170.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin makes 6-hour journey from her home to Edinburgh
170.article_body: The casket of Queen Elizabeth II is on a six-hour journey from her home in the Scottish Highlands to Edinburgh. The procession will give a chance to the public to pay tribute to the Queen. Princess Anne, Queen's daughter, is to accompany the procession. The Queen's state funeral will be held at Westminster Abbey in London on September 19.

171.title: Urvashi issues clarification over viral video after Naseem's 'I don't know her' remark
171.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to Instagram to issue a clarification over her viral video featuring Pakistan cricketer Naseem Shah after the latter stated he doesn't know who Urvashi is. "Couple of days back...my team shared...fan-made cute edits (around 11-12) without any knowledge of other people involved in it. Would kindly request...media to not create any sort of news," she wrote.

172.title: Harsha Bhogle names his Team of Asia Cup 2022, includes 2 Indians
172.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has named his Team of Asia Cup 2022. He has included four Pakistanis, two Indians, two Afghans and three Sri Lankans in his XI. He has named Virat Kohli and Bhuvneshwar Kumar in the team. Further, he has named Muhammad Rizwan as the opener and wicketkeeper. The team also includes Sri Lankan captain Dasun Shanaka.

173.title: Woman falls unconscious on flight from Dubai to Kochi, declared dead after landing
173.article_body: A 56-year-old woman fell unconscious on a flight from Dubai to Kochi on Saturday and was declared dead at a hospital in Kochi, police said on Sunday. "She was taken to a private hospital nearby after the flight landed but was declared dead," police said. Police haven't filed any case as the death was due to natural causes, reports said.

174.title: Pak are favourites to win Asia Cup but can't take the young SL lightly: Akram
174.article_body: Ahead of the Asia Cup 2022 final today, cricketer-turned-commentator Wasim Akram has said Pakistan are favourites to win the match but the "young" Sri Lankan team can't be taken lightly. "Pakistan's middle order...[was] exposed in the last game...hopefully, they come back stronger," added Wasim. Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by five wickets in their Super 4 stage match on Friday.

175.title: Man creates 36 fake GST companies in Maharashtra, generates fake invoices worth ₹132 cr
175.article_body: A man in Maharashtra created 36 fake GST companies through which he generated fake invoices worth ₹132 crore and established network to pass-on fake Input Tax Credit of ₹23 crore. Officers of CGST Bhiwandi Commissionerate arrested him on Friday after conducting search operation at his residential premises. This is the 17th arrest by CGST Bhiwandi Commissionerate in last one year.

176.title: I'm sure I'll be in final again: Jabeur after losing in US Open 2022 final
176.article_body: After losing her second straight Grand Slam final at US Open 2022, Tunisian Ons Jabeur said, "Definitely I'm not someone that's going to give up."
