350.title: Theatres open early morning, late night shows of 'Brahmāstra' amid huge demand
350.article_body: With many shows of 'Brahmāstra' going houseful, theatres in many major centres have opened early morning and late night shows to keep up with increased demand. On Saturday, some people tweeted screenshots of theatres in Delhi opening shows as early as 6 am for IMAX version. New shows mean the film will run in some screens for almost 21 hours.

351.title: Argentine TV anchor celebrates Queen's death by drinking champagne, criticised
351.article_body: An Argentinian TV presenter was criticised for celebrating Queen Elizabeth II's death by drinking champagne live on air. A video of the broadcast showed Santiago Cúneo pouring himself a drink while the message "The old bag of s*** has died" flashed on the screen. "I'm Argentinian...this guy doesn't represent me," said a Twitter user, while another called him a "disgrace".

352.title: Australia's Warner, Stoinis ruled out of 3rd ODI against New Zealand
352.article_body: Australia all-rounder Marcus Stoinis has been ruled out of the team's third and final ODI against New Zealand due to a side strain, while opener David Warner was released from the squad to rest. There is no injury concern for Warner. The third ODI will be played on Sunday. Australia lead the three-match ODI series 2-0.

353.title: House collapses into river after cloudburst in U'khand; video surfaces
353.article_body: A woman died and nearly 50 houses were left submerged in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh after a cloudburst was reported near the Dharchula town, officials said. In a video shared by Uttarakhand Police's Fire Service, a house is seen collapsing into the Kali river. Pithoragarh DM Ashish Kumar Chauhan said 170 affected people of Khotila village have been evacuated.

354.title: 40% of electric vehicles in Delhi bought after 2020 policy: Govt
354.article_body: The sale of electric vehicles (EVs) in Delhi increased after the implementation of the 2020 Electric Vehicles Policy, with 40% of all vehicles being bought after the policy came into effect. According to official data till August 31 this year, Delhi has over 1.64 lakh electric vehicles. Of these, 67,063 vehicles were purchased after the policy's implementation.

355.title: 19-yr-old Hyd woman killed by man for rejecting his marriage proposal
355.article_body: A 19-year-old woman from Hyderabad was allegedly killed by a man for rejecting his marriage proposal in Telangana's Wanaparthy. On August 5, the accused asked the woman to visit his village. When she reached there, he asked her to marry him, but she refused, leading to an argument between them. Following this, he reportedly strangled her with her dupatta.

356.title: Haryana Police arrest man for committing ATM fraud in 3 states
356.article_body: The Haryana Police on Saturday said they arrested a man, Rohit alias Amit, who was allegedly involved in ATM fraud cases in Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan. Amit used to fraudulently obtain automated teller machine (ATM) cards from unknown people and clone them. Later, on the pretext of helping them, he used to get passwords and siphon money, police said.

357.title: 'Dhokha: Round D Corner' was completed in just 29 days: Director Kookie
357.article_body: Director Kookie Gulati revealed that he completed the shoot of his upcoming film, 'Dhokha: Round D Corner', in 29 days. "We kept a target to finish...in 44 days but with...proficiency of R Madhavan, Khushali (Kumar), Darshan (Kumaar) and Aparshakti (Khurana), we were able to complete [it] in just 29 days," he said. The film will be released on September 23.

358.title: My mind is blown, Rajamouli is a genius: Jennifer Beals on RRR
358.article_body: American actress Jennifer Beals, known for films like 'Flashdance' and 'The Book of Eli', on Friday tweeted, "I just watched the epic RRR in a theatre and my mind is BLOWN." Calling the film's director SS Rajamouli a "genius", she added, "Leaving the theatre, I wanted to work out, dance and meditate-all at once. Long live the revolutionaries!"

359.title: Shah lays foundation stone of border tourism development work in Rajasthan
359.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday laid the foundation stone of border tourism development work at India-Pakistan border in Rajasthan, around 120 kilometres from Jaisalmer. He laid the foundation stone of the project as part of his two-day visit to Rajasthan. "For the first time...development is reaching the border areas under the leadership of (PM) Modi ji," Shah said.

360.title: Rahul Gandhi needs to study history first: Amit Shah on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
360.article_body: Taking a swipe at Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Rahul Gandhi needs to study the country's history first. "[In] his speech given in Parliament, Rahul...said India is not a nation at all...in which book have you read this?" Shah said. "This is the nation for which lakhs...of people have sacrificed their lives," he added.

361.title: No metro services between Qutab Minar, Sultanpur on Sunday morning
361.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has announced that train services will not be available from Sultanpur to Qutab Minar on the Yellow Line for going towards Samaypur Badli from 5:15 am to 6:00 am on Sunday. The services are being suspended due to maintenance work. However, trains will be available from Qutab Minar for going towards Samaypur Badli.

362.title: Home registration in Hyd region see 36% yr-on-yr decline in Aug: Report
362.article_body: Registration of residential properties in the Hyderabad region fell 36% year-on-year (YoY) to 5,181 units in August 2022, as per Knight Frank India. In August 2021, 8,144 housing units were registered in the Hyderabad residential market that includes four districts — Hyderabad, Medchal-Malkajgiri, Rangareddy and Sangareddy. The value of properties transacted in August 2022 was ₹2,657.8 crore.

363.title: Virat Kohli shares childhood pic, says 'Eat, drink and enjoy'
363.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli took to his Instagram Stories to share a childhood picture of himself, wherein he can be seen eating. "Khao piyo aish karo mitro...Dil par kise da dukhayo na (Eat, drink and enjoy, friends...but don't hurt anyone's feelings)," he wrote in the caption, using lyrics from the 2001 Punjabi song 'Aish Karo'.

364.title: Indian Sikh brother reunites with Pakistani Muslim sister 75 years after Partition
364.article_body: Jalandhar-based Sikh man Amarjit Singh met his Muslim sister Kulsoom Akhtar from Pakistan at Gurdwara Darbar Sahib in Kartarpur, 75 years after he was separated from his family at the time of Partition. Talking to Pakistan's Express Tribune, Kulsoom said her parents migrated to Pakistan from a suburb in Jalandhar in 1947, leaving behind her brother and a sister.

365.title: Pools in Hockey WC are always difficult: Indian men's team head coach Reid
365.article_body: After India were drawn in Pool D with England, Spain and Wales in Hockey World Cup 2023, Indian men's hockey team head coach Graham Reid said World Cup and Olympics pools are always difficult. "Every team is there to win. We just played England and Wales in...Birmingham 2022 Commonwealth Games and the games were of the highest quality," he added.

366.title: 173 lumpy skin disease cases reported in Delhi: Minister Gopal Rai
366.article_body: Delhi has so far recorded 173 cases of lumpy skin disease with most cases reported in the city's south and west, Minister for Environment Gopal Rai said. Most cases have been reported from the Goyla Dairy area (45 cows) and Rewla Khanpur (40 cows). The symptoms include nodules on the cow's skin, fever, watery eyes and weight loss.

367.title: Nearly half of the dengue cases in 2022 were reported in Aug: PMC
367.article_body: Nearly half of the suspected dengue fever cases reported this year under the Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) limits were recorded in August. According to the PMC's data, 2,621 suspected cases of dengue were reported till September 3. "At least 1,062 suspected cases of dengue viral fever were detected in August itself," said Assistant Health Chief, PMC, Dr Sanjeev Wavare.

368.title: Last of Moosewala's 6 shooters, his 2 aides arrested near Bengal-Nepal border
368.article_body: Punjab Police said the last of the six shooters involved in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, Deepak Mundi, was arrested on Saturday from near the West Bengal-Nepal border, along with two of his associates. "Deepak was the shooter in Bolero module, [while] Kapil Pandit and Rajinder provided logistical support, including weapons and hideouts," Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said.

369.title: US sanctions Iran's Intelligence Ministry over cyberattack on Albania
369.article_body: The US Treasury Department on Friday imposed new sanctions on Iran's Ministry of Intelligence for its alleged involvement in a cyberattack against NATO member and US ally Albania in July. The move came after Albania severed diplomatic ties with Iran and ordered the expulsion of Iranian diplomats and embassy staff on Wednesday over the incident.

370.title: 96 samples of sweet, snacks, ghee & edible oil collected in Mumbai
370.article_body: As part of a drive initiated before the beginning of Ganeshotsav, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in Mumbai collected 96 samples of sweets, snacks, ghee and edible oil sold in markets. As many as 51 samples of sweets, six samples of snacks and seven samples of edible oil were sent for quality check purposes, an FDA official informed.

371.title: His real face is anti-Hindu: Sambit Patra on Rahul Gandhi's video with pastor
371.article_body: Reacting to a video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi with Tamil pastor George Ponnaiah, BJP leader Sambit Patra said it's not the first time Rahul has made indecent remarks against Hinduism. He said Rahul visits temples during elections to create a farce. "When elections conclude, this farce of Rahul...ends and his real...anti-Hindu face...comes to light," he added.

372.title: No music allowed in dressing room for India Women's T20I as England mourns Queen's death
372.article_body: Players will not be allowed to play music in the dressing room during India Women-England Women's first T20I at the Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street. This comes as England is mourning the demise of Queen Elizabeth II. Further, there will be no commercial activity allowed inside the stadium, reports said. The country's flags at the venue will also be at half-mast.

373.title: Police seize 860 kg marijuana from Assam's Karbi Anglong, 3 held
373.article_body: The Assam Police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) seized 860 kg of marijuana and 40.70 grams of suspected heroin from a truck in Karbi Anglong district on Saturday. Three persons have been arrested in the case. The truck was coming from Manipur and the drugs were hidden inside a secret chamber of the truck's body, a police official said.

374.title: What does 'EIIR', seen on the throne during King Charles' accession ceremony, mean?
374.article_body: The symbol 'EIIR' was seen on the throne of the British monarch during King Charles III's accession ceremony in St James' Palace on Saturday. It is the late Queen Elizabeth II's royal cypher and stands for Elizabeth II Regina, as 'Regina' means queen in Latin. The cypher is likely to change to 'CIIIR' to represent King Charles, reports said.

375.title: The film student in me needs to watch Brahmastra again: Hrithik
375.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter on Saturday to praise Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra', saying, "The film student in me needs to watch Brahmastra again." "The action, the grading, the BGM, the VFX, the sound design uff...Absolutely incredible work!! Too good," he wrote, adding, "Thoroughly enjoyed this one." The film reportedly collected ₹35-36 crore at the domestic box office on Friday.

376.title: Bomb explodes in front of RSS worker's residence in Kerala
376.article_body: A bomb exploded in front of a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker's house in Kannur, Kerala, on Thursday night. According to Mattannur Police, the bomb exploded about 50 metres away from the house of RSS worker Sudheesh. Police have registered a case under the Explosives Act. Notably, police said that Sudheesh is also accused in many cases.

377.title: Pune admin to acquire 6,000-hectare land for Purandar airport
377.article_body: The Pune district administration said it will require 6,000 hectares of land for the Purandar Airport and logistics park. This followed Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's announcement that the airfield will be constructed along with a logistics park. As per the initial proposal, the airport would require 2,832-hectare land. The proposed logistical park will require additional 3,103-hectare land.

378.title: Suriya's next pan-India 3D film to release in 10 languages
378.article_body: Actor Suriya's next film, tentatively titled 'Suriya 42', will be shot in 3D and be released in 10 languages. Disha Patani has been roped in to play the female lead in the upcoming film. It will be directed by Siva. The motion poster of the film was launched on Friday. Suriya was recently seen in Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram'.

379.title: Man shot at in Mumbai's Bandra by unidentified assailant
379.article_body: A man was shot by an unidentified assailant in Mumbai's Bandra East area on Thursday, a police official told PTI on Friday. The bullet fired by the assailant hit the victim on his back, the official added. The official further informed that the victim is undergoing treatment at a hospital. "An attempt to murder case has been registered," he stated.

380.title: 11 suffer electric shock during Ganesh idol immersion in Panvel
380.article_body:
At least 11 persons in Panvel suffered an electric shock after a wire from the generator machine snapped during Ganesh idol immersion. "One is in the ICU, while two of those affected are small children aged five and 15," Panvel Municipal Corporation Commissioner Ganesh Deshmukh said. 
Deshmukh added that the police were yet to determine why the wire snapped.

381.title: Will stand with Ukraine for as long as it is necessary: Germany
381.article_body: Germany's support for Ukraine wouldn't falter in the face of reduced Russian energy supplies, German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said as she arrived in Kyiv. "We'll stand by Ukraine for as long as necessary," Baerbock said, adding that German support would include arms and financial aid. It's Baerbock's second visit to Kyiv since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

382.title: I'll win this thing: American Tiafoe after losing in US Open semis
382.article_body: Following his loss in the US Open semi-final, US' Frances Tiafoe said, "I gave everything I had these past two weeks...This one really, really hurts." He added, "I'm going to come back and I'll win this [US Open] thing one day." Tiafoe lost to Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(8-6), 3-6, 1-6, 7-6(7-5), 3-6. Both were playing in their maiden Grand Slam semi-final.

383.title: PM Modi proud of his heritage, unlike Nehru: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
383.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday said unlike former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru, PM Narendra Modi is "proud" of the country's heritage. "There was one Prime Minister who didn't feel proud of his heritage, and then there's Narendra Modi, who has resolved to make the whole India, 'Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat', by connecting with his heritage," he said.

384.title: 25-yr-old man booked for raping Class 2 student in UP's Ballia
384.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been booked for allegedly raping a Class 2 student in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia. The accused reportedly lured the seven-year-old girl when she was playing outside and took her to his house on a motorcycle, where he raped her, police said. A case was registered after the girl's father filed a police complaint.

385.title: 'The Lion King' prequel announced, film to release in 2024
385.article_body: A prequel to the 2019 film 'The Lion King' was announced on Friday. Titled 'Mufasa: The Lion King', the upcoming film will release in 2024. Oscar-winning director Barry Jenkins, who's set to helm the project, said it is a "story about how Mufasa rose to royalty". The film will also feature the younger versions of characters Timon, Pumbaa and Rafiki.

386.title: Don’t have a plan that requires people to return to office: Amazon CEO
386.article_body: Amazon doesn't have plans to ask its corporate employees to return to office with CEO Andy Jassy saying, "We don't right now. But we're going to proceed adaptively as we learn." During the COVID-19 pandemic, Amazon had announced in October 2021 that it would leave it up to individual managers to decide when workers needed to come to office.

387.title: 'Secularism experts' now decide who's secular, who's communal: Owaisi
387.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday criticised Opposition parties for posing as "experts of secularism". "When we speak of the development of minority communities...nonsense is spoken against us. This is hypocrisy in a way that those posing as experts of secularism today will decide who's secular and who's communal," Owaisi said while addressing a press conference in Ahmedabad.

388.title: Area around Kartavya Path barricaded, visitors find difficult to find parking
388.article_body: Visitors found it difficult to find the four newly developed parking lots along Kartavya Path in Delhi. The area was barricaded, reports said, adding that one of the four parking lots was closed while the police said that parking lots were opened for the public. Security guards at parking located between C-hexagona and Man Singh Road only allowed government vehicles.

389.title: CCTV video shows dog biting food delivery man's private parts in Mumbai
389.article_body: A CCTV video, showing a pet dog biting a Zomato delivery man on his private parts inside a Mumbai building, has been widely shared online. The video was captured by a camera inside an elevator as the delivery person was exiting it on August 29. The man was reportedly hospitalised and the dog's owner paid his medical bills.

390.title: Forming 'khichdi govt' with weaker PM better than 'two-time PM': Owaisi
390.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said that it will be better to form a "khichdi" government with a weaker PM than a "two-time PM" who complains about the system. "Those posing as experts of secularism today will decide who's secular and who's communal…BJP has 306 MPs, yet the PM complains about the system," Owaisi added.

391.title: ED raids Kolkata premises in fraud gaming app case; ₹7 cr seized so far
391.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday raided several premises in Kolkata in a fraud mobile gaming application case. The ED has seized ₹7 crore as of now. Cash counting machines have been brought by the ED as the counting of cash is ongoing. A man named Amir Khan, who had launched gaming application 'E-Nuggets', has been accused in the case.

392.title: Online gaming firm Roblox plans to launch 3D advertising next year
392.article_body: Online gaming firm Roblox Corporation said on Friday that it is planning to launch 3D advertising on its platform next year, adding that it will test ads with developers and some advertisers by this year-end. Better known as "immersive ads", the 3D advertising experience will be available to audiences aged only 13 and above, the California-based company said.

393.title: Will regularise temporary employees in states where AAP forms govt: Kejriwal
393.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal said his party will regularise temporary employees wherever it forms government. While lauding the AAP-led Punjab government for regularising 8,736 school teachers, Kejriwal urged all state governments to do the same. He further termed the contractual employment system "exploitative" and said only permanent employees should be there in the government.

394.title: Military base, road in Arunachal's Kibithu named after Bipin Rawat
394.article_body: A military station along the LAC in Arunachal Pradesh's Kibithu and a 22-kilometre-long stretch of road were named after former CDS General Bipin Rawat, who died in a helicopter crash last year. The station was named as Gen Bipin Rawat Military Garrison, while the road as Gen Bipin Rawat Marg. A life-size mural of Rawat was also unveiled, said officials.

395.title: Child-lifting rumours trigger mob attacks in UP, 35 booked in several incidents
395.article_body: Child-lifting rumours reportedly triggered widespread panic in parts of Uttar Pradesh. Reports said that several incidents of mob lynching and killing on suspicion of being a child-lifter increased following such rumours. An official said that so far 35 people were booked over several incidents that took place in the state. The police have said that these rumours are baseless.

396.title: US imposes sanctions on Iran over cyberattack on Albania
396.article_body: The US on Friday imposed sanctions on Iran's Intelligence Ministry and its minister in response to a July cyberattack that disrupted government websites in Albania and for engaging in other cyber activities against the US and its allies. On Wednesday, Albania severed diplomatic relations with Iran for the incident, ordering Iranian diplomats and embassy staff to leave within 24 hours.

397.title: 'Huge gap' in National Education Policy 2020: Manish Sisodia
397.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia expressed disappointment over the National Education Policy (NEP), 2020 and said that it cannot be implemented immediately as there is a "huge gap" in the scheme. "Changes are needed in NEP 2020...It is also the vision of Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal that education-related policies are given a 360-degree view," said Sisodia.

398.title: IIT Hyderabad releases statement after death of 2 students by suicide
398.article_body: IIT Hyderabad released a statement after the death of two of its students by suicide. In a statement, the institute said students feel pressure at the beginning of their projects, however, they're given time to grasp the requirements. On September 7, a former IIT Hyderabad student allegedly died by suicide and on August 31, an MTech student died by suicide.

399.title: 'Dog Officers' are ensuring Ganpati venues are safe: Pune police
399.article_body: The Pune City Police on Friday tweeted, "Our 'Dog Officers' Surya and Rana [are] ensuring all Ganpati venues and adjacent lanes are safe for us 'humans'!" The police also shared pictures of the same and said that the bomb detection and disposal teams are inspecting areas. The police added that all safety precautions are being taken amid the celebrations.

400.title: 1,108 kg ganja worth ₹2 crore seized near Assam-Tripura border, 1 held
400.article_body: Police seized 1,108 kg of ganja worth about ₹2 crore in Karimganj district along the Assam-Tripura border on Friday. One person has been arrested in the case. Police said that the ganja was seized from a truck coming from Tripura towards Guwahati. The ganja was recovered from a secret chamber in the truck.

401.title: Hopeful of at least two more trade deals by year-end: Piyush Goyal
401.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India recently signed two trade agreements with the UAE and Australia. He also hopes to conclude the negotiations for two more such pacts by the year-end. Free trade agreement (FTA) negotiations with the UK are expected to be finalised this month, while talks with Canada for a deal are progressing well.

402.title: Typical BJP mischief: Congress on video of pastor telling Rahul 'Jesus is real God'
402.article_body: Congress has reacted to a video shared by the BJP, showing a pastor telling Rahul Gandhi, "Jesus is the real God." Congress communication in charge Jairam Ramesh called the video "typical BJP mischief", saying that BJP's tweet bore "no relation whatsoever to what is recorded in the audio". The video is from Rahul's meeting with Father George Ponnaiah.
